pros: damage to our physical health that overwork can cause. A study from the World Health Organization (WHO) found that working an average of 55 hours or more each week increases your risk of stroke by 35 percent and your risk of dying from heart disease by 17 percent, compared to averaging a 35-40 hour workweek.
cons: puts in 90 hours a week, is his “light” season. The rest of the year, he works upwards of 120 hours per week—leaving only 48 hours for sleeping, eating, entertaining, and (he smiles) bathing. Sudhir stays late in the office even when he has nothing particularly pressing to do. His get-a-life existence is a hazard of the profession—but worth it: As a 23-year-old with a first job, he is in the top 6% of earners in America.

pros: Very few; you work here when you are desperate and few or no other options. You get Fridays off in the summer but that's only for full-time administrators; teachers & student employees don't have that apply exactly, the school is just closed.
cons: Cons Exhaustive; socialist, social justice warrior, dreamers everywhere, paradise or hell?; more time (90%) spent keeping your hind quarters protected rather than doing actual work; advancement based on politics over productivity; liars. Trump supporter? Don't tell, the institutional liberal bias is deep and vicious. Independent thought discouraged. Cheap. Very cheap.

review_title: Once a great place to work
pros: As a member of the state university system in New Jersey, Kean provided good salaries with excellent benefits. For many years it was an enjoyable and rewarding place to work.
cons: After a few scandals broke about the university administration, the atmosphere began to change; it was no longer an enjoyable place to work. I became embarrassed to tell people where I worked.

review_title: Okay at first; sporadically got worse
pros: Casual work environment with friendly and helpful coworkers.  Semi-flexible schedule.  Free on campus gym membership.  Faculty/Staff parking.  Able to attend on campus daily/weekly/monthly events.  Free food/drinks left over at end of events.
cons: You're forced to work at least three days a week since Academic Specialist don't get paid for working eight hours in a day (maximum of 15 hours/week).  You can't make up hours from a previous week.  No benefits.  No promise of becoming full time if you're interested.  No guarantee of continued work when your "contract" is up.  Some Academic Specialist's (like myself) are hired to work in a job that's meant to be full time.  Also, the seriousness of some of the work Academic Specialist do can have big consequences.  I was in a serious part-time position and the work I did impacted many students.  I think Kean hired Academic Specialist to test out how much hours are needed to fulfill a specific job function in a department.  Academic Specialists are hired on a "project-based" assignment contributing their skills and abilities for a short time period and their job shouldn't be treated as if it were a full time job.  It was continuously and very overwhelming and frustrating to manage my workload in the hours given, regardless of how efficient or effective I was with my work.  I felt bad when I usually didn't have the time to finish something and it had a negative impact on students.  I assessed this early on and pushed and worked harder to provide data to substantiate good reason to make my position full time.  I asked and was told time to time that it would happen, but down to the end they made budget excuses.

review_title: I have very positive attitude toward the school I graduated from and my working experience there.
pros: I got useful skills that helped me both to graduate and to find a full time job right after graduation. Staff was very helpful, flexible schedule, normal rate for such a job.
cons: They are using Kronos to record the time clock . It is not working well and made me rush to work to clock in on time. No pay for the 15 min of work otherwise.

pros:
-Whatever department you belong to, becomes a sort of family to you under good conditions.

-In the situation that you work hard and really stay on the good side of management, you could get raises easily.
cons:
-Sometimes there is a lack of "sense" with the things that go around at the University.

-Often you may have very conflicting opinions about the right thing to do in certain work situations.

pros: The students are mostly very eager to learn. The staff is great and we work together as a team well.

review_title: Student Worker for the Office of Internships

cons: The cons of working at Kean University as a student worker for the Office of Internships is that other students will ask you for help at all times of the day even when you aren't working.

job_title: Teaching Adjunct in Morris Plains, NJ
pros: In my experience, faculty members are willing to provide advice and support to adjunct faculty. Adjuncts are allowed the flexibility to develop instructional content and methodology.
cons: Although course time slots generally accommodate individual schedules, note that full-time faculty have priority in order to fulfill teaching obligations. Hours are sometimes less than ideal.

review_title: Good salary and benefits. Professors are great. Management needs more professional development.
pros: State job with a good salary and benefits. Professors are great. Location is close to all major highways and transportation.
cons: Some management were not qualified to be directors which made the job very hard for those employees that did know the job. Turn-around of employment is very high at this university.

review_title: Great job for students who are trying to balance work and school.
pros: Very easy, just watch the pool and make sure nobody drowns. Lots of down time, which allows you to get a majority of your school work done.
cons: Biggest con is that if there aren't enough guards at the pool you may be on your watch shift for more than a couple of hours at a time and that can be immensely boring.

review_title: Associate Director, Office of Student Accounting
pros: Great working facilities and working space and equipment. Salary and benefits are reasonable.
cons: Room for improvement for school  computer operating system, very inefficient for users, creating high personnel costs. Performance evaluation system is horrible it becomes a personal tool for political purposes. Hard workers are not recognized and appreciated. Workplace moral is low.

review_title: Kean's heart is in the right place.  They offer many affordable programs to attract a diverse student body.

review_title: This was by far my best employment experience

cons: Honestly, there is nothing bad I can say about working for Kean. This employment experience taught me a lot and also helped me along the way.
